intro: Disticholiparis govidjoae, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers with a distinctive color pattern. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with a prominent central lip that is often a different color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
